results.title: The Effects of war never change
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jeff Freeman and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jeff only served 2 years in the army in South Vietnam. It was extremely hard to return to normal life and keep an office job after one year in the jungle. The reaction to Vietnam veterans in Australia only made it harder for him to adjust back into a normal life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jeff Freeman and ACMI

results.title: Solving work problems
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Peter Quarry introduces a 3 step process for discussing poor work performance with staff. Discusses real life examples of common mistakes together with the correct way to counsel staff.
results.description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Improving Performance”.

results.title: Solving the problem (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The final step in the process of performance appraisal is reaching a solution relevant to the problem and its cause which involves considering realistic options, agreeing on a clear action plan and setting a review date to ensure the plan is working.

results.title: Phil's case (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Phil works in despatch. Complaints about mistakes and late deliveries prompted his supervisor Kris to talk with him attempting to resolve the problem. Peter Quarry then assumes the role of supervisor using the three step approach.
results.description:

results.title: Jude's case
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Jude is a conscientious researcher in a professional market research team. Her supervisor wants her to be more creative and she is shocked and resentful at his feedback. Peter Quarry assumes the role of supervisor and uses the 3 step approach.

results.title: What's the problem? (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Peter Quarry demonstrates how to implement the important first step of performance appraisal which is to determine and agree on the work performance problem. However, supervisors make mistakes including unclear and vague feedback, providing insufficient evidence and failing to gain agreement.

results.title: Heather's case (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The youngest clerical worker in a project team is angry about staff who are inconsiderate, messy and who avoid her whilst her colleagues have complained to the new supervisor about her being aggressive. The supervisor attempts to resolve the problem and then Peter Quarry assumes the role of supervisor and uses the 3 step approach.
